newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Taiwan CPC buys July fuel oil at $123/T, $129/T.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan CPC buys July fuel oil at $123/T, $129/T.

text.p: Taiwan's state-owned Chinese Petroleum Corp (CPC) has bought two 38,000-tonne 0.5-percent sulphur fuel oil cargoes for July deliveries at $129 and $123 per tonne respectively, a company official said on Thursday.
The low-pour cargo for July 16-25 delivery was bought at $129 per tonne and the July 6-15 high-pour cargo was at $123 per tonne, the official said.
The cargoes were bought on a cost-and-freight (c-and-f) basis to Keelung, Taichung or Shenao.
In its last fuel oil purchase, CPC bought two 38,000-tonne cargoes of 0.5-percent fuel oil at around $124 per tonne for July 1-10 delivery.
